name: RACV Torquay Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over a weekend to celebrate 6th wedding aniversery.
reviews.title: New and Fresh, will be better with age

reviews.text: Room was very spacious, modern and clean. ( as you would expect its new )
reviews.title: Great new resort with everything you need!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I played golf, Course is good but still a few temporary holes & greens in play.
reviews.title: A few good things, a few disappointments

reviews.text: Will be better in a few months time when the full course is open and grown in.
reviews.title: Great complex but lacking in spirit.
Not one single problem
reviews.text: Wife had a Spa treatment and said its one of the best she has had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our recent weekend at The RACV Torquay resort, such a quick and easy drive from Melbourne. The building is impressive and beautiful. The staff were fantastic; whether reception, housekeeping or in the bistro and restaurant we were well looked after.
reviews.title: A great escape from Melbourne
Rossandmichelle
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious ( love the high ceilings and windows) the bed and linen so comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was not being able to get into the day spa as it was booked out! The Spa menu looked amazing.
reviews.title: Most impressive new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All you could want for a very enjoyable, relaxing but super comfortable escape from Melbourne. Looking forward to going back!
reviews.title: A great place to relax..

reviews.text: Check in a breeze, great undercover parking direct lift access to your rooms floor. Quality architecture here, very new. Rooms and bathrooms have all things needed. Both bedroom and bathrooms spacious with small balcony overlooking golf course through to Southern ocean. Mini bar and toiletries good quality product. Finish up to say you need psychiatric treatment if you decide to stay anywhere else in Torquay.
reviews.title: Great value great location great times

reviews.text: The night we stayed the resort was at full capacity for the first time, not that you would have know. It was so quiet we couldn't hear a thing when in our room. Had a glorious hour in the day spa being pampered before dinner in the restaurant. Fantastic gym. All the staff happy and helpful. My only complaint was breakfast could have been hotter, and we were amongst the first to eat.
reviews.title: From Sydney

reviews.text: Having previously enjoyed fabulous service, food and accommodation at RACV Inverloch Resort and RACV Healesville Country Club our expectations of a luxurious stay at Torquay were met.
reviews.title: You Can’t Go Wrong With RACV

reviews.text: We booked a Premium Ocean View Room, twin share. Large room, great beds, well decorated, excellent TV, plush carpet, reasonably priced mini bar, quality complimentary tea and coffee (Nespresso machine) and a nice touch of a fresh lemon. Lush bathroom with L’Occitane toiletries, bath tub, walk in shower, and great lighting options.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel

reviews.text: Included buffet breakfast in Number One Restaurant was comprehensive and of high quality. Quality table settings as would be expected. Wait staff friendly and courteous but slow to clear and both days did not replace our cutlery (once cleared) – nothing that can’t be improved with a little training.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, superb views, delicious food and great facilities

reviews.text: Three course dinner night one at Number One was delicious, service a little slow but a lovely experience overall.
reviews.title: Fabulous new resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend and was very impressed. From check-in to check-out the staff were very helpful. The room was very good. We visited both restaurants which were both very good, we preferred the more casual bistro. The buffet breakfast was one of the best I have experienced, although not good for the waistline. Fortunately, there is a fully featured gym and pool so I was able to burn off a few of the calories. The location is convenient, a 15 minute walk into the centre of Torquay or the nearest beach.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay at excellent hotel
Nearly perfect
reviews.text: Highly recommended, will definitely return.

Have just spent a night at RACV Torquay and was very impressed. We had a premium ocean view room. Upon arriving in our room there was a note acknowledging a birthday with wine and chocolates which was a very nice and unexpected touch. The room was very spacious with a nice little area to sit and watch the ocean as well as a very nice balcony area. We had dinner in the "Number One" restaurant which was near perfection. The quality of the food was fantastic and our waiter, Christopher was amazing, we would take the 2 hour drive from home just to go there for dinner again. Only hiccup we had was at breakfast the next morning. We were seated for breakfast and given orange juice with tea and coffee to follow. Unfortunately the wait for the tea and coffee proved to be a long one. We had actually finished our breakfast and had to ask for our tea and coffee just before we were about to leave. Maybe this should be offered on seating rather than the juice as I would think most people like to start with tea/coffee. Overall though a great place well worth a visit
reviews.title: Excellent & clean rooms with beautiful view of landscaped golf course with ocean in the background.

reviews.text: Stayed in 2 adjacent ocean view rooms in Oct 2013 with 4 adults and 1 child. Rooms were clean with good views and toilets were in immaculate condition. The ladies made use of the pool whilst the men (+ child) went fishing at Fishermen Beach. The reception counter on checkin was good and knowledgeable and recommended places to fish when we asked. Breakfast was adequate ... the service was exceptional with one staff (Jessica) very patient and service-orientated to all having breakfast. It is staff like Jessica who made the stay in this resort not only good but exceptionally GREAT. Will make a repeat stay if ever I am in Melbourne in the near future.
reviews.title: Great property let down

reviews.text: The physical facilities of the new RACV Club at Torquay are tremendous. The architecture is appealing and suits the setting very well. The rooms and public areas are appealing and comfortable.
reviews.title: Everything we expect of an RACV resort and more

description: Perched within the backdrop of the Torquay and Jan Juc beaches, RACV Torquay Resort is set on an expansive golf course with spectacular ocean views and direct beach access.Offering something for all tastes, RACV Torquay Resort features a range of facilities including a family friendly Restaurant and bar, Day Spa, Indoor pool, children’s playground, conference and meeting facilities and the picture perfect location for a wedding ceremony and reception. This picturesque resort is ideally located. A leisurely 75 minute drive from Melbourne CBD and 40 minutes from Avalon airport.
